title: HRL: Curiosity/novelty bonuses from JEPA prediction error
acceptance_criteria: - Compute curiosity reward from JEPA prediction error and latent novelty\n- Integrate into RL training scripts with weighting knob\n- Ablation shows behavior change vs no-curiosity

title: OOD: 'Surprise tasks' benchmark suite and harness
acceptance_criteria: - Design and implement OOD surprise tasks per blueprint Section 7\n- Integrate into evaluate_arc.py with separate reporting\n- Baseline runs and JSON outputs committed

title: Docs: Add CONTRIBUTING.md and contributor guidelines
acceptance_criteria: - CONTRIBUTING.md with environment setup (uv), testing, style, commit etiquette\n- Mention Beads workflow and history/ for planning docs\n- Linked from README

title: JEPA: Multi-step context (k=3) per ADR 0002
acceptance_criteria:
- training/jepa/dataset.py returns k-step context-target sequences (k=3 default)
- Encoder path accepts temporal context and aggregates correctly
- Config knob for context length; tests updated
- Verified training runs with k=3 on a tiny manifest

title: Performance passes and GPU-ready batching for guidance/solver
JEPA dataset loader + augmentations + JSONL manifest reader
Add curriculum + OOD dataset configs (pilot_curriculum.yaml, pilot_ood.yaml)
description: Provide example configs that (a) mix phases via task_schedule for progressive learning; (b) produce an OOD slice with larger grids, expanded palettes, and sparser fill. Include notes on evaluating both splits and expected distribution differences in summary.json.
acceptance_criteria:
- configs/data/pilot_curriculum.yaml exists with task_schedule {atomic, sequential}
- configs/data/pilot_ood.yaml exists with larger grid sizes, palette range, and low fill_probability
- scripts/generate_dataset.py runs successfully on both and writes manifests and summaries
- summaries show expected shifts (program_length, grid_size, palette counts)

title: Meta-JEPA rule-family trainer
ARC dev set loader and evaluation harness
Learned HRL option policies and discovery from RL traces
Solver: Parallel/Batch beam search
acceptance_criteria: - Add batched/parallel evaluation of beam candidates\n- Maintains search semantics; improves throughput on multi-core\n- Config knob to enable; unit tests unaffected

title: Meta-JEPA: Hierarchical clustering for rule families
acceptance_criteria: - Implement hierarchical clustering over program embeddings\n- Expose family levels for prior scoring\n- Evaluation shows improved grouping over exact-match

title: JEPA: Invariance constraints (symmetry/color/translation)
acceptance_criteria: - Add invariance losses per blueprint (color/translation/symmetry)\n- Configurable weights; ablation shows effect on eval metrics\n- Unit tests on synthetic transforms

title: Train guidance scorer and verify beam search ranking
notes: Trained guidance scorer via PYTHONPATH=. .venv/bin/python scripts/train_guidance.py --jepa-config configs/training/jepa_pretrain.yaml --dsl-config configs/dsl/guidance.yaml --epochs 3 (loss 0.0158→0.0020). Saved checkpoint to artifacts/guidance/model.pt. Verified beam search ranking on mirror_y task: top-3 beam outputs scored ≈0.183 with mirror_y succeeding, confirming scorer integrates with GuidedBeamSearch.

title: JEPA: Vectorize object tokenization
description: Rewrite tokenize_grid_objects and related routines to minimize Python loops: leverage tensorized ops (PyTorch/NumPy), vectorized connected-component labelling, and batch color/geometry feature extraction. Add micro-benchmarks and ensure outputs match prior implementation.
acceptance_criteria: - tokenize_grid_objects runtime reduces >2x on representative grids\n- Numerical outputs match prior implementation within tolerance\n- Benchmarks and a unit test added (skippable on CI if too slow)

title: JEPA: Relational consistency losses
acceptance_criteria: - Add loss encouraging consistent pairwise relations across views\n- Integrates with relational module\n- Improves stability/representation metrics on small eval

title: Generator CLI: curriculum fallback + allowed_primitives + outlier knobs
description: Extend dataset generator CLI to support (1) root-level task_schedule mixing phases and fallback to generator.curriculum_phase + samples for backward compatibility; (2) generator.allowed_primitives to constrain structural primitives; (3) simple OOD knobs via config (palette range/grid size/fill_probability overrides) without changing code. Document in README and pilot configs.
acceptance_criteria:
- scripts/generate_dataset.py accepts task_schedule at root and falls back to generator.curriculum_phase when present
- generator.allowed_primitives supported and honored by SyntheticARCGenerator
- Pilot config using task_schedule generates mixed-phase dataset (summary shows mixed program_length)
- OOD config with larger grids/palettes and low fill generates manifest; summary reflects shifts
- README updated with examples

title: Generate synthetic ARC dataset and validate distributions
notes: Ran scripts/generate_dataset.py --config configs/data/pilot.yaml after fleshing out the CLI. Generated 5,000 atomic tasks to data/pilot/manifest.jsonl with accompanying summary.json (grid 8-12x8-12, palette size 6, mean changed cells 59.6). PNG export skipped because Pillow is not installed on this machine.

title: Guidance: Structure-aware program encoder (TreeLSTM/Graph)
acceptance_criteria:
- Replace mean-pooling with structure-aware encoder (TreeLSTM or GNN)
- Improves correlation with success by >X% on held-out tasks
- Integrates with GuidedBeamSearch and caches
- Unit tests for encoder shapes and simple trees

title: JEPA InfoNCE objective + projection head + memory queue
Meta-JEPA: Learnable temperature for contrastive loss
acceptance_criteria: - Replace hardcoded temperature with learnable parameter (clamped)\n- Training stable; small improvement in retrieval or loss\n- Config option to fix or learn temperature

title: JEPA: Throughput profiling and batch tuning on A6000
description: Add a simple profiler script to measure sample/sec, GPU SM utilization, CPU core usage vs (batch_size, num_workers, grad_accum_steps, amp on/off). Produce a short report recommending defaults for A6000 (8 CPU / 48 GB RAM) and update configs accordingly.
acceptance_criteria: - profiling script runs locally and on A6000\n- report with recommended settings (batch size, workers, amp, grad accumulation) checked into artifacts or docs\n- configs/training/jepa_pretrain_gpu.yaml updated with tuned defaults

title: JEPA: DataLoader with workers, pinned memory, non-blocking transfers, and grad accumulation
description: Wrap JEPA dataset with torch DataLoader (configurable num_workers, pin_memory). Move tokenization into __getitem__ where applicable. Use non_blocking=True on .to(device). Add optional gradient accumulation to maintain large effective batch sizes if memory-bound. Expose knobs in config (training.num_workers, training.grad_accum_steps).
acceptance_criteria:
- train_jepa.py uses DataLoader with pin_memory and configurable num_workers
- ObjectTokenBatch.to/device path supports non_blocking transfers
- Optional grad accumulation controlled by config; correctness verified vs baseline
- CPU utilization spreads across ≥6 workers on 8-core machine; GPU SM utilization ≥50% on A6000 for batch≥1024
- Epoch time reduces materially vs single-threaded path

title: Synthetic ARC generator + JSONL exporter (Atomic→Sequential curriculum)
Docs: Expand discovery.py docstrings and examples
acceptance_criteria: - Add detailed docstrings to discover_option_sequences and helpers\n- Include example usage and edge cases\n- Lint passes and docs build if applicable

title: Run evaluation/ablation suite and produce JSON report
notes: Evaluated 5k-task pilot manifest via PYTHONPATH=. .venv/bin/python scripts/evaluate_arc.py --tasks data/pilot/manifest.jsonl --top-k 3 --max-nodes 3 --output artifacts/eval/pilot.json. Summary: DSL-only success 35.1% (1754/5000, avg 226.9 programs), meta-guided top-3 success 24.8% (1240/5000, avg 17.0 programs). Full per-task metrics saved to artifacts/eval/pilot.json.

title: JEPA: Pre-tokenized dataset pipeline and loader
description: Build a preprocessing script to convert manifest (input/output) into pre-tokenized tensors (features/mask/adjacency) with metadata, sharded into .pt files. Add a TokenizedPairDataset that streams these to GPU without per-step Python tokenization. Update train_jepa.py to auto-switch when pretoken_path is present in config. Include a backfill tool to convert existing manifests and a small regression test on a tiny shard.
acceptance_criteria:
- scripts/pretokenize_jepa.py generates sharded .pt files from a JSONL manifest
- training/jepa/dataset.py exposes TokenizedPairDataset with __len__/__getitem__ for DataLoader
- train_jepa.py loads tokenized dataset when config.pre_tokenized.path is set
- 1 epoch wall-clock improves >3x vs baseline on A6000 (batch 1024)
- Unit smoke test validates a shard loads and matches on-the-fly tokenization numerically within tolerance

title: DSL: Expand primitive library (topology, compositional, conditionals) to 50+
acceptance_criteria:
- Add flood_fill, connected_components, component_ops (area, bbox, centroid)
- Add map/filter/fold combinators; conditional if-then-else
- Update registry + docs; 10+ unit tests for new ops
- Solver supports new primitives without regressions

title: Option discovery/promotion cycle on collected episodes
notes: Scripted option discovery using mirror_x→mirror_y episodes (two traces) to satisfy min_support=2. Discovered auto_mirror_x__mirror_y_5cb3895b with support 2, success_rate 1.0, avg_reward 1.25; promoted into DSL registry and verified promoted primitive reproduces transformation.

title: Curated training configs and logging (TensorBoard)
Evaluation: Track latent distance-to-goal during inference
acceptance_criteria: - Compute and log JEPA latent distance-to-goal per step\n- Include in eval JSON and plots\n- Verified on a small set

title: HRL: RLlib integration scaffold (env adapters, trainer wiring)
acceptance_criteria:
- training/rllib_utils/ contains env wrappers for envs/arc_latent_env.py and option interfaces
- RLlib PPO trainer runs on latent env with JEPA reward (single-worker test)
- scripts/train_hierarchical.py trains PPO with sample YAML config
- Config docs added under configs/training/rl/ and README section

title: Relational attention/GNN over object tokens using adjacency
Meta-JEPA training smoke (rule family embeddings)
notes: Ran meta-JEPA smoke via PYTHONPATH=. .venv/bin/python scripts/train_meta_jepa.py --tasks data/pilot/manifest.jsonl --epochs 2 --batch-size 64 --min-family-size 1; training completed with flat 0.0 loss (tiny contrastive set) and weights saved to artifacts/meta_jepa/model.pt.

title: Tests: Increase mocking to decouple heavy implementations
acceptance_criteria: - Refactor tests to mock heavy modules where practical\n- Faster local runs; maintain coverage\n- Guidelines added for test design

title: Curriculum: 5-phase curriculum pipeline with metrics
acceptance_criteria: - Implement curriculum phases operationally with progression logic\n- Track metrics: codebook usage, option diversity, solve rates\n- Configurable schedules; documented examples

title: HRL: Behavioral cloning pretraining for option policies
acceptance_criteria:
- scripts/pretrain_bc.py trains supervised policies from episodes JSONL
- Data loader for RL traces (state, action, option) with splits
- Training config + metrics (accuracy, loss) saved
- Policies loadable as initialization for PPO/A2C runs

title: Program length schedules and compositional curriculum in generator
description: Allow configuring program length distributions beyond current fixed 1 (atomic) and 2–3 (sequential). Support a schedule (e.g., {2:0.6,3:0.3,4:0.1}) and honor root-level program.max_depth when present. Update metadata and summaries to reflect distributions.
acceptance_criteria:
- Generator reads a program length config/schedule and samples lengths accordingly
- program.max_depth in config limits max length when provided
- Metadata program_length reflects sampled length; summary shows intended histogram on a sample run
- Backward compatibility preserved for existing configs

title: Training: Validation splits and early stopping
acceptance_criteria: - Add train/val splits for JEPA/meta-jepa/guidance\n- Implement early stopping on val metrics\n- Configurable patience; document usage

title: HRL options + envs with JEPA latent reward
Meta-JEPA: Relational prediction tasks (transformations-of-transformations)
acceptance_criteria: - Add auxiliary task predicting composition effects between rules\n- Demonstrate improved prior ordering or generalization\n- Toggleable via config

title: Training: DDP support for JEPA pretraining
acceptance_criteria: - Add PyTorch DDP support in train_jepa.py\n- Configurable world size; works on single node\n- Document launch commands; tiny run validates

title: Evaluation: Run ARC-1 dev benchmark and record baseline metrics
acceptance_criteria:
- Implement evaluation manifest loader for ARC-1 dev set if missing
- Run evaluate_arc.py across dev set
- Commit baseline JSON metrics: success rate, program counts, time
- Document baseline + method settings in README

title: Latent option env rollouts and reward sanity check
notes: Ran latent option env smoke via PYTHONPATH=. .venv/bin/python scripts/rollout_latent_env.py --env-config configs/envs/latent_options.yaml --jepa-config configs/training/jepa_pretrain.yaml --episodes 4. Rewards: [-0.389, 0.948, 0.952, -0.400] with two 1-step successes, avg reward 0.278 confirming reward shaping.

title: Integrate Meta-JEPA priors into DSL search
notes: Implemented Meta-JEPA priors via training/meta_jepa/prior.py. FewShotSolver now accepts meta_prior to re-rank programs and GuidedBeamSearch mixes similarity bonuses into neural scores. Added grid change-count utility, unit tests (test_meta_jepa_prior.py), and docs updates. Pytest (79 tests) green.

title: Wire full JEPA training into scripts/train_jepa.py (manifest + epochs + checkpoints)
description: Replace NotImplementedError with dataset-backed training: parse dataset_manifest from YAML, construct ManifestGridPairDataset with augmentations/batch size, invoke ObjectCentricJEPAExperiment.train for configured epochs, and checkpoint to artifacts. Keep --dry-run behavior. Print epoch losses and write minimal metrics JSON.
acceptance_criteria:
- scripts/train_jepa.py accepts configs/training/jepa_pretrain.yaml and runs N epochs on manifest
- checkpoints written to artifacts/jepa/pretrain (or config path)
- per-epoch loss printed; final JSON metrics file saved
- unit smoke test: runs one small epoch on a tiny manifest in CI/local

title: Few-shot solver end-to-end run with promoted primitives
notes: Executed FewShotSolver E2E on mirror_x→recolor task. Without promotion (max_nodes=1) solver failed after 6 candidates. After mining two episodes and calling augment_registry_with_options, promoted auto_mirror_x__recolor_source_1_target_2_f2381624 enabled success with 1-node program (evaluated 7 candidates).

title: JEPA dry-run and short training smoke test
notes: Executed JEPA dry-run via PYTHONPATH=. .venv/bin/python scripts/train_jepa.py --config configs/training/jepa_pretrain.yaml --dry-run; run completed with Dry-run loss 0.0 confirming trainer wiring.

title: Meta-JEPA: Graph/attention encoder for rule embeddings
acceptance_criteria: - Replace MLP with graph/attention encoder over program structures\n- Improves retrieval/score alignment vs baseline\n- Trains on same JSONL with comparable runtime

title: Strengthen neural-symbolic ARC pipeline
description: Implement the roadmap to tighten object-centric representations, DSL-driven reasoning, and evaluation for the hybrid JEPA + HRL system.

title: Integrate object-centric perception and discrete latents
description: Add object parsing, relational graph reasoning, and vector-quantized latent bottlenecks so JEPA embeddings capture crisp symbolic structure.
notes: Relational aggregation added; JEPA object pipeline now uses adjacency-aware encoder with InfoNCE training.

title: Define ARC DSL and symbolic enumerator
description: Design a typed DSL for grid transformations, implement interpreter and consistency checks, and wire it into the training stack.

title: Train neural guidance for program search
description: Develop scoring models over DSL programs using JEPA/GNN features, support beam search heuristics, and integrate with the solver loop.

title: Automate option discovery and DSL promotion
description: Build pipelines to discover latent options, validate them against invariants, and register them as new typed primitives with regression tests.

title: Implement few-shot ARC solving pipeline
description: Wire constraint-driven enumeration, caching, and MDL priors to solve ARC tasks from 2-3 examples with the new DSL and neural guidance.
notes: Bootstrap DSL scaffolding (types, primitives, enumerator) to support neural-guided search.

title: Run ARC evaluation and ablation suite
description: Benchmark the full pipeline on synthetic splits and ARC dev set, including ablations for JEPA-only, HRL-only, DSL search, and report solve rates vs compute.

title: JEPA: Mixed precision (AMP) training
description: Enable torch.cuda.amp autocast + GradScaler in JEPA loop: projection head, InfoNCE logits and loss, queue normalization. Add training.amp=true flag and verify numerical stability (temperature clamping, loss scale). Include fallback to CPU/FP32 when AMP unavailable.
acceptance_criteria:
- training/jepa/loop.py uses autocast+GradScaler when training.amp=true
- Loss/accuracy curves consistent (within noise) vs FP32 on small runs
- GPU epoch time improves on A6000 with batch 1024+
- Config option documented; disabled by default on CPU

title: Add MDL priors, caching, constraint pruning to solver
DSL: Type system expansion (inference, polymorphism)
acceptance_criteria: - Extend types beyond strings: product/sum types, shapes, colors\n- Basic type inference and checking in interpreter\n- Unit tests for type safety across primitives

title: E2E: JEPA → Meta-JEPA → Solver integration tests
acceptance_criteria: - Add integration test that runs tiny JEPA pretrain, meta-jepa encode, guided solver on a small ARC subset\n- Asserts success rate and program counts within thresholds\n- Runnable locally in <10 min (tiny configs)

title: Bug: Fix JEPA queue enqueue timing relative to optimizer step
acceptance_criteria: - Ensure negative queue updates occur before/after step as intended\n- Add comment/tests validating correct contrastive queue semantics\n- No regression in loss curves on tiny run

title: JEPA: Target encoder with stop-gradient (BYOL-style)
acceptance_criteria:
- Separate target encoder with EMA and stop-gradient
- Modify loss to compare online vs target branches
- Config knobs for EMA decay; tests for gradient flow
- Regression: converges on tiny run similar to baseline

title: Bug: Implement options/promotion.py and promote_discovered_option
acceptance_criteria:
- training/options/promotion.py added with promote_discovered_option(...)
- Wire into training/solver/few_shot.py callsites
- Unit tests for promotion + registry augmentation
- No runtime error when promotion path executed

title: HRL: Actor–critic policy networks for options
acceptance_criteria:
- training/rllib_utils/models.py defines ActorCritic for discrete options and manager policy
- Supports option termination and value estimation
- Unit smoke test: forward pass shapes and action sampling valid
- Integrated with RLlib trainer via custom_model

title: DSL Tests: Property-based testing with Hypothesis
acceptance_criteria: - Add Hypothesis-based tests for primitives and enumerator\n- Cover shape/color invariants and interpreter safety\n- Tests run quickly and are stable locally

title: HRL: High-level manager selecting low-level options
acceptance_criteria: - Implement manager policy over option space with termination handling\n- Integrates with RLlib multi-agent or hierarchical wrapper\n- Tiny run shows manager selecting options end-to-end

title: VQ: Dead-code revival / codebook usage refresh
acceptance_criteria:
- Implement codebook re-seeding for unused embeddings (EMA-aware)
- Periodic refresh without destabilizing training
- Unit test: unused code revived and receives assignments in synthetic test
- Config knob to enable/disable

title: Evaluation: Novelty metrics (novel rule discovery rate)
acceptance_criteria: - Implement novelty metrics during eval runs\n- Report and store per-run novelty JSON fields\n- Document metric definitions

acceptance_criteria:

- YAML configs under configs/training/rl/ for each method
- Checkpoint/metrics logging with JSON outputs

title: Training: Gradient clipping and LR scheduling
acceptance_criteria: - Add gradient clipping in JEPA/meta-jepa/guidance loops\n- Add LR schedulers with config knobs\n- Show stability improvements on tiny runs
